textboxes.description: You've just received a contract to repair a submarine hypernet cable that has been severed deep underwater. The cable is crucial for a major corporation, and any delay will result in a loss of data for thousands of clients. You're descending into an underground maintenance chamber on a remote island, where the hypernet cable is supposed to be accessed. The environment is dark, the air is humid, and the humming of machines fills the space. You need to assess the damage and begin the repair work immediately.

choices.text: Inspect the damage and begin troubleshooting the cable.
Start by checking the equipment in your toolkit.
Look for a control panel to check if there are any emergency protocols activated.

textboxes.description: You begin by carefully inspecting the cable. The severed ends are submerged in a small, flooded section of the chamber. A few sparks are visible where the cable is damaged, but the area is too wet to safely approach without precautions. The cable is made of complex fiber-optic components, and it looks like the severance has damaged the inner conduits. You'll need to use specialized tools to repair the fibers without causing more harm. Time is critical, and you need to act quickly.

choices.text: Use your electronics skills to short-circuit the water and disable the electrical hazards.
Dive into the flooded section carefully to repair the cable manually.
Search for more tools in your toolkit to safely handle the repair.

textboxes.description: You start by checking your toolkit. You have all the necessary gear, including fiber-optic splice tools, a water-tight electrical box, and a few emergency heat-shrinking kits. You notice that the cable repair will need precise work to reconnect the damaged fibers while preventing further water damage. You'll need to use the right equipment for the job. If you make a mistake, it could result in catastrophic failure.

choices.text: Use the heat-shrinking kits to cover the damaged areas and prevent water leakage.
Start preparing the fiber-optic splice tools and reconnect the fibers manually.
Check the control panel for any additional instructions or diagnostics.

textboxes.description: You find the control panel embedded in the wall and begin reviewing the diagnostics. The cable is indeed broken, but there are several warning signs indicating that the system is at risk of a larger failure if the cable is not restored soon. The diagnostics are encrypted and you’ll need to bypass them to get the full information. It’s a job for someone with cryptography skills, but you’ll need to act fast before the system starts malfunctioning.

choices.text: Try to hack the diagnostic system and decrypt the data.
Ignore the diagnostics for now and proceed with the cable repair.
Activate emergency repair mode and attempt to bypass the diagnostics.

textboxes.description: You carefully use your electronics skills to short-circuit the water and disable the electrical hazards. It takes a few moments, but you manage to cut off the power to the flooded section. The water level begins to drop, and you can finally get closer to the cable to make your repairs. However, you can still see some of the inner conduits exposed, and you’ll need to handle the delicate fiber-optics carefully to avoid further damage.

choices.text: Proceed with the manual fiber-optic repair.
Use the emergency heat-shrinking kits to seal the exposed areas first.
Inspect the remaining exposed components for any signs of further damage.

textboxes.description: You decide to dive into the flooded section carefully, feeling the cold water as you wade through it. The severed cable is within reach, but the water is still a risk to the electrical components. You’re able to begin making repairs, but there’s a risk of shock if you make any wrong moves. You must proceed carefully to avoid making the situation worse.

choices.text: Use the splice tools carefully to reconnect the severed fibers.
Focus on sealing the fiber-optic components with the heat-shrinking kits first.
Use a shock-proof tool to test the integrity of the cable before proceeding.

textboxes.description: You start sealing the exposed areas of the cable with the heat-shrinking kits. The task requires precision, as the shrinking process needs to be done carefully to avoid overheating the components. You manage to get most of the seals in place, but you notice that there’s still some minor leakage around the cable.

choices.text: Use the remaining kit to reinforce the seal around the cable.
Proceed with the manual repair of the fiber-optic connections.
Check the diagnostics again to verify if there’s a deeper issue.

textboxes.description: After a tense and careful effort, you successfully reconnect the fibers and seal the damaged parts of the cable. The power has been restored, and the submarine hypernet cable is operational once more. You carefully run diagnostics, and everything seems to be working as expected. The repair is complete, and you've saved the project from failure. The client will be relieved, and you'll receive a hefty payment for your work.

You successfully decrypt the diagnostic data, revealing that the cable’s severance was caused by a deep-water anomaly. The system has been under strain, and without your repair, a larger failure would have been inevitable. You now have more insight into the full scope of the issue, which will help you in the future. The repair work goes smoothly after your hacking success, and the cable is operational once again.

Ignoring the diagnostics, you focus on repairing the cable manually. After a challenging few hours, you manage to splice the fibers and secure the damaged cable. The system is restored, but you’re unsure if the larger issue has been addressed. You’ve completed the job, but there could be long-term complications.

You manage to bypass the diagnostics, forcing the system into emergency repair mode. The cable is restored, but there are many questions left unanswered. The company may not be happy with your unorthodox approach, but at least the repair is complete. You've avoided the worst of the damage.

You carefully inspect the exposed components and find additional wear and tear. The inner conduits are in worse shape than initially thought. Repairing these will require even more specialized equipment. You'll need to make a choice: proceed with the repair or call for reinforcements.

choices.text: Call for reinforcements and delay the repair.
Attempt the repair yourself with the tools you have.

textboxes.description: You decide to use a shock-proof tool to test the integrity of the cable before proceeding with the repair. The test reveals that the cable is still live, and there’s a risk of a short-circuit if you touch the wrong components. You’ll need to proceed carefully and shut off the power before continuing.

choices.text: Shut off the power to the cable and proceed with the repair.
Attempt to bypass the power and repair it under live conditions.

textboxes.description: Reinforcements arrive to help you with the cable repair, and after a few more hours of work, the job is completed. The cable is fully restored, and the diagnostics are run. There are no further issues, and the client is satisfied with the result.

You manage to complete the repair by yourself, despite the complicated conditions. The cable is up and running again, but you realize that it was a close call. You’ve completed the job, but it’s a relief to know that you won’t have to face that kind of challenge again anytime soon.

Attempting the repair under live conditions results in an electrical shock that temporarily disables your equipment. You’re forced to halt the repair and start over after resetting everything. The delay costs you time, and the company is not pleased with your unorthodox approach.
